content: fo now you will join the inner and outer ear together crocheting through both ear pieces at once hold the inner and outer ear pieces together ensuring the rs of each ear piece is facing outwards continue in brown and crochet round 2 through both ear pieces as shown below ©the secret craft book r2 increase 6 times 12 sts fo leaving a long tail for sewing arms make 2 r1 with brown working into a magic_ring 6 single_crochet 6 sts r2-9 single_crochet around 6 sts do not stuff fo leaving a long tail for sewing legs make 2 r1 with brown working into a magic_ring 6 single_crochet 6 sts r2-9 single_crochet around 6 sts do not stuff fo leaving a long tail for sewing tail r1 chain 15 r2 starting in second chain from hook single_crochet to end 14 sts fo leaving a tail for attaching the tail to the body ©the secret craft book assembly attaching the head to the body use the tail end of yarn to sew the head on to the body line up the 6 sts from the body with the 6 sts from the head and join attaching the ears sew the ears onto the side of the head attaching the face and muzzle sew the face onto the front center of the head then lightly stuff the muzzle and sew onto the bottom part of the face see image 1 which highlights how little stuffing you need you can now embroider the facial features see image 2 and cover image for an idea of how this could be done image 1 ©the secret craft book attaching the arms sew the arms onto the side of the body where the head and body meet attaching the legs sew the legs onto the underside of the body you can choose to have these in a standing or sitting position attaching the tail finally sew the tail in position see image your mini-mal monkey is now complete
